file.content:
name: CraftedSpecially CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
  workflow_dispatch:

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: crafted-specially/crafted-specially
  BUILD_CONFIGURATION: Release

permissions: {}

jobs:

  analysis:
    name: Static/Dependency Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@de0fac2e4500dabe0009e67214ff5f5447ce83dd # v6.0.2
        with:
          persist-credentials: false

      - name: Trivy scan (repo)
        run: |
          docker run --rm \
            -e TRIVY_DB_REPOSITORY=public.ecr.aws/aquasecurity/trivy-db,aquasec/trivy-db,ghcr.io/aquasecurity/ \
            -v "${{ github.workspace }}/Services/Catalog:/src" \
            aquasec/trivy:latest \
            fs -f json --scanners vuln,secret,misconfig \
            --exit-code 1 --severity HIGH,CRITICAL /src

  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: analysis
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@de0fac2e4500dabe0009e67214ff5f5447ce83dd # v6.0.2
        with:
          persist-credentials: false

      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@baa11fbfe1d6520db94683bd5c7a3818018e4309 # v5.1.0
        with:
          dotnet-version: '10.0.x'

      - name: Cache NuGet
        uses: actions/cache@cdf6c1fa76f9f475f3d7449005a359c84ca0f306 # v5.0.3
        with:
          path: ~/.nuget/packages
          key: nuget-${{ runner.os }}-${{ hashFiles('**/packages.lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: nuget-${{ runner.os }}-

      - name: Restore dependencies
        run: dotnet restore ./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj --locked-mode

      - name: Check for vulnerable dependencies
        run: dotnet list ./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj package --vulnerable

      - name: Build
        run: dotnet build ./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj --output buildOutput --no-restore --configuration Release

      - name: Generate SBOM
        run: |
          curl -Lo $RUNNER_TEMP/sbom-tool https://github.com/microsoft/sbom-tool/releases/latest/download/sbom-tool-linux-x64
          chmod +x $RUNNER_TEMP/sbom-tool
          $RUNNER_TEMP/sbom-tool generate -b ./buildOutput -bc . -pn CraftedSpecially -pv 1.0.0 -ps ByteBrew -nsb https://blognet.tech -V Verbose
      
      - name: Upload a Build Artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@b7c566a772e6b6bfb58ed0dc250532a479d7789f # v6.0.0
        with:
          name: catalog-api-build-output
          path: buildOutput
      
      # Docker build and push steps
      - name: Log in to GitHub Container Registry
        uses: docker/login-action@c94ce9fb468520275223c153574b00df6fe4bcc9 # v3
        with:
          registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
          username: ${{ github.actor }}
          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Build and push Docker image
        id: build_and_push
        uses: docker/build-push-action@263435318d21b8e681c14492fe198d362a7d2c83 # v3
        with:
          context: ./Services
          file: ./Services/Catalog/dockerfile
          push: true
          tags: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository_owner }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}:latest
    
    outputs:
      digest: ${{ steps.build_and_push.outputs.digest }}

  sign_and_provenance:
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    name: Sign & Attest
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    
    permissions:
      id-token: write
      contents: read
      packages: write
      attestations: write
      
    steps:
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@37930b1c2abaa49bbe596cd826c3c89aef350131 # v4
        with:
          name: catalog-api-build-output
          path: buildOutput

      - name: Log in to GitHub Container Registry
        uses: docker/login-action@c94ce9fb468520275223c153574b00df6fe4bcc9 # v3
        with:
          registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
          username: ${{ github.actor }}
          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Generate build provenance
        id: generate_provenance
        uses: actions/attest-build-provenance@96278af6caaf10aea03fd8d33a09a777ca52d62f # v3.2.0
        with:
          subject-name: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository_owner }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}
          subject-digest: ${{ needs.build.outputs.digest }}
          push-to-registry: true

      - name: Generate SBOM attestation
        uses: actions/attest-sbom@4651f806c01d8637787e274ac3bdf724ef169f34 # v2
        with:
          subject-name: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository_owner }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}
          subject-digest: ${{ needs.build.outputs.digest }}
          push-to-registry: true
          sbom-path: ./buildOutput/_manifest/spdx_2.2/manifest.spdx.json

      - name: Upload attestation artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@b7c566a772e6b6bfb58ed0dc250532a479d7789f # v4
        with:
          name: catalog-api-provenance
          path: ${{steps.generate_provenance.outputs.bundle-path}}
  
  # deployment: 
  #   needs: sign_and_provenance
  #   name: Deploy to Azure
  #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest

  #   permissions:
  #     contents: read
  #     id-token: write
  #     actions: read

  #   environment: Deployment

  #   steps:
  #     - name: Checkout repository
  #       uses: actions/checkout@v5
  #       with:
  #         persist-credentials: false
  #     - name: Azure Login
  #       uses: azure/login@v1
  #       with:
  #         client-id: ${{ secrets.AZURE_CLIENT_ID }}
  #         tenant-id: ${{ secrets.AZURE_TENANT_ID }}
  #         subscription-id: ${{ secrets.AZURE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID }}
      
  #     - uses: azure/setup-kubectl@v4

  #     - uses: azure/aks-set-context@v4
  #       with:
  #         cluster-name: CraftedSpecially-aks
  #         resource-group: CraftedSpecially

  #     - uses: Azure/k8s-deploy@v5
  #       with:
  #         namespace: 'crafted-specially'
  #         manifests: |
  #             ./Services/Catalog/deployment.yml

Perfect! Now let me create a comprehensive summary. Here's my thorough exploration report of the CraftedSpecially project structure:

## CraftedSpecially Project Structure - Comprehensive Exploration Report

### Overview
CraftedSpecially is a .NET 10.0 modular monolith application using clean architecture principles. The project demonstrates vertical slicing with a catalog module. It uses .NET Aspire for orchestration and Azure Bicep for infrastructure.

### 1. Solution File and Root Configuration

**Solution File:**
- `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/CraftedSpecially.sln` - Master solution file with all 7 projects

**Key Configuration Files:**
- `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/Directory.Build.props` - Global build properties:
  - Target Framework: `.NET 10.0`
  - Package lock files enabled
  - Runtime identifiers: `win-x64`, `linux-x64`
- `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/nuget.config` - NuGet configuration
- `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/dotnet.config` - Global dotnet configuration

### 2. src/ Directory Structure

#### Core Projects (at root of src/):

**A. CraftedSpecially.Api** 
- Path: `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/src/CraftedSpecially.Api/`
- Type: ASP.NET Core Web API
- File: `CraftedSpecially.Api.csproj`
- Dependencies:
  - `CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults`
  - `Catalog.UI` (from modules/catalog)
- Key Files:
  - `Program.cs` - Application entry point, sets up WebApplication
  - `appsettings.json` / `appsettings.Development.json`
  - `CraftedSpecially.Api.http` - REST endpoints for testing
  - `packages.lock.json`

**B. CraftedSpecially.AppHost**
- Path: `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/src/CraftedSpecially.AppHost/`
- Type: .NET Aspire AppHost orchestrator
- File: `CraftedSpecially.AppHost.csproj`
- Key Files:
  - `AppHost.cs` - Orchestrates the distributed application setup
  - `appsettings.json` / `appsettings.Development.json`
  - `packages.lock.json`

**C. CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults**
- Path: `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/src/CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults/`
- Type: Class Library (.NET SDK)
- File: `CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults.csproj`
- Key Files:
  - `Extensions.cs` - Shared service configuration extensions
  - `packages.lock.json`

#### Module Structure (Modular Monolith):

**Catalog Module** - Path: `/Users/tom/Documents/workspace/private/CraftedSpecially/src/modules/catalog/`

The catalog module follows clean architecture with 4 projects per CLAUDE.md specification:

**1. Catalog.Domain**
- File: `Catalog.Domain.csproj`
- Purpose: Domain entities and business logic
- Key Files:
  - `Beer.cs` - Domain entity with properties: Id, Name, Style, Abv, Description, Brewery, Price
- No external dependencies (purely domain logic)

**2. Catalog.Application**
- File: `Catalog.Application.csproj`
- Purpose: Application services and use cases
- Implements Vertical Slicing pattern
- Dependencies: `Catalog.Domain`
- Key Files:
  - `CatalogInstrumentation.cs` - Observability instrumentation
  - `GetAllBeers/GetAllBeers.cs` - Use case handler containing:
    - `IBeerRepository` interface (application contract)
    - `GetAllBeersHandler` class implementing the GetAllBeers use case
- Uses OpenTelemetry for activity tracing and metrics

**3. Catalog.Infrastructure**
- File: `Catalog.Infrastructure.csproj`
- Purpose: External service implementations, repositories
- Dependencies: `Catalog.Application`

# Stage 1: Build
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:10.0 AS build
COPY ["./Directory.Build.props", "."]
COPY ["./nuget.config", "."]
COPY ["./Catalog/Catalog.Api/", "./Catalog/Catalog.Api/"]
COPY ["./Catalog/Catalog.Application", "./Catalog/Catalog.Application/"]
COPY ["./CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults/", "./CraftedSpecially.ServiceDefaults/"]
RUN dotnet restore "./Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj" --configfile ./nuget.config --locked-mode
RUN dotnet publish "./Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj" -c Release -o /app/publish --no-restore

# Stage 2: Runtime
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/aspnet:10.0 AS runtime
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=build /app/publish .

# Security: Create non-root user and switch to it
RUN groupadd --system appgroup && useradd --system --gid appgroup appuser
USER appuser

# Environment variables
ENV ASPNETCORE_URLS="http://+:8080"
ENV ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT="Production"

# Expose only necessary port
EXPOSE 8080

# Healthcheck
# HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=10s --retries=3 \
#   CMD curl --fail http://localhost:8080/health || exit 1

# Start the app
ENTRYPOINT ["dotnet", "Catalog.Api.dll"]

input.content:
# Update CI for Modular Monolith

## Context
The project migrated from separate microservices (`Services/Catalog/...`) to a modular monolith (`src/` with a root solution file). The CI workflow still references old paths and an old Dockerfile that was deleted during migration.

## Changes

### 1. Create new Dockerfile
**File:** `src/CraftedSpecially.Api/Dockerfile`

Multi-stage build adapted from the old `Services/Catalog/dockerfile`, updated for the new project layout:
- Build stage copies `Directory.Build.props`, `nuget.config`, and all projects from `src/`
- Restores and publishes the `CraftedSpecially.Api` project
- Runtime stage stays the same (non-root user, port 8080)
- Build context will be the repo root (so paths in Dockerfile start from root)

### 2. Update `.github/workflows/ci.yml`

| Section | Old path/value | New path/value |
|---------|---------------|----------------|
| Trivy scan volume | `Services/Catalog:/src` | `src:/src` |
| dotnet restore | `./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj` | `./CraftedSpecially.sln` |
| dotnet list vulnerable | `./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj` | `./CraftedSpecially.sln` |
| dotnet build | `./Services/Catalog/Catalog.Api/Catalog.Api.csproj` | `./CraftedSpecially.sln` |
